29.24.text:
Welcome to Fieldsports Britain. Coming up
reaction to our head-shooting film - we gauge

37.19.text:
The CLA game fair 2013 - This year we want
it to be bigger and better and nobody more

43.11.text: so than stand holder Fur Feather & Fin.

46.76.text:
We've got news stump - with the weird and
the wonderful, hunting youtube with the sublime

51.49.text:
the ridiculous and a new social media series
called Hallo Charlie.

57.15.text:
First - high definition Night vision is giving
us a whole new view on life. Let's join the

61.86.text:
Pied Piper of Pellets, Roy Lupton, on a chicken
farm with a rat problem.

77.55.text:
Now we might as well be honest about this
- there's not a great deal of substance to

81.37.text:
this film. However there is some fab night
vision shots of rats, lots of rats, going

88.37.text:
about their business, while the neighbours
try to get some shut eye.

93.01.text:
This working farm yard is busy by day and
busy by night, but it's rearing the wrong

98.26.text:
type of livestock. The rats are treating it
like a funfair - stuffing their faces and

103.55.text:
playing on the rides, although it's more like
the tea cups than the corkscrew.

109.30.text:
To help sort out this brown rat bonanza is
Roy and his sub 12 ft/lb Webley and a smidgeon

115.93.text: of night vision expertise. He loves rats - not!

119.78.text:
Well we have been invited tonight to come
and shoot some rats on the chicken farm and

126.52.text:
as we have been standing here the wretched
things have been running around and by the

130.94.text:
looks of them they are not rats they are the
size of cats. And as you probably know they

135.28.text:
are the one animal on God's earth that I am
absolutely petrified of. So I am going to

139.14.text:
make sure I can get up somewhere high and
shoot down on them. I am certainly not standing

142.79.text:
on the floor. I think we are going to be in
for a bit of a good time tonight. So I am

147.09.text:
hoping we can have a bit of fun as long as
I am up out of the way that is all I care

155.46.text:
It's easy to forget that this place is pitch
black and you wouldn't be able to see your

158.88.text:
hand in front of your face in the shed itself
- however, with the Nightmaster infra-red

164.17.text:
illuminators atop the scopes we're sitting
pretty - well, sitting high up in Roy's case.

170.29.text:
The chickens don't seem to care that rats
are dropping down dead all around them. Rattus

175.19.text:
norvegicus is plentiful here. Darren tells
us that in the first few hours of darkness,

180.55.text:
and even after one of the team gets a pellet,
they're prepared to run the gauntlet far sooner

185.59.text:
than they are after midnight. After the witching
hour, it looks like they have had their fill

190.76.text: and are not so keen to break cover.

194.01.text:
The rats keep falling - and eventually with
frost forming on the cameras we call it a

199.09.text: night. Roy has to face his demons.

202.22.text:
Give me anything else, but just not a rat
please. Oh God. We have got a bit of a pile

210.80.text:
of rats down there now and there is still
a load more in there and I am most certainly

214.59.text:
not going and picking them up. I should have
brought a little picky uppy thing because

218.44.text:
I certainly can't handle them. There are a
couple of other friends here who will pick

223.31.text:
them up, it just sends shivers up my spine
thinking about it. What absolute fun. You

230.10.text:
really can't have any more fun on a freezing
cold night in an old farmyard with an air

236.37.text:
rifle it is brilliant, brilliant fun, superb
sport. And obviously doing a good job. We

242.17.text:
are relieving the rat problem here and allowing
the chickens to sleep a little better at night.

250.18.text:
Rats, and being close to them does funny things
to people. Rat shooting for some reason, dare

255.41.text:
I say it, is funny. I know that respecting
your quarry is imperative but seeing a rat

260.94.text:
on what could conceivably be a merry-go-round
makes you smile. And what about this for the

266.42.text:
circle of life: here's a farm cat having a
munch - just remember this image next time

272.04.text: Tiddles wants to give you a lick.

275.38.text:
Roy Lupton there showing that it's OK for
a grown man to cry. Right last week we did

280.96.text:
things a bit differently. We uploaded a film
age-restricted with images we thought were

286.80.text:
too graphic to show to under 18's. If you
are watching this on Youtube and you are logged

292.19.text:
in and you are over 18 you can click on the
screen to go through to that film.

297.31.text:
We always enjoy hearing what people think
of us apart from the dodgy sweary antis who

302.78.text:
issue death threats of course. Even if you
weren't keen on the film thank you for posting.

308.57.text:
The vast majority of you felt that film was
a worthwhile exercise. So it is up to us to

314.75.text:
decide what is decent and put it up and what
is tasteless and either age restrict it or

321.17.text:
not put it up and it is up to you to tell
us.

324.89.text:
It's by no means the first time we've shown
slow-motion shots of birds and animals being

329.86.text:
shot. We of course have the air rifle shots
and we were surprised the rifle shots in our

335.22.text:
long-range high-impact films didn't get more
of a negative response. We are learning all

340.64.text:
the time about the sort of content people
want and enjoy.

344.85.text:
YouTube is an amazing phenomenon and we want
to make sure we continue to produce the most

351.40.text:
entertaining and informative films on hunting,
shooting and fishing films available.

356.42.text:
And on that note it's probably best to cross
to David on the Fieldsports Channel News Stump.

368.99.text:
A $50 bounty to control the coyote population
in Utah has got hunters licking their lips.

377.13.text:
It's got environmentalists crying foul and
state wildlife administrators stuck somewhere

382.55.text:
in the middle. Coyotes prey on deer fawns
and the state has paid out on 6,000 coyotes

388.52.text:
in the last year, but that's only a tiny proportion
of the US$2.3 billion the state makes from

398.16.text:
Don't shoot hares in England from 1st March
to 31st July.

403.66.text:
That's the party line from the new code of
practice for brown hare management in England.

408.35.text:
Written by BASC and the GWCT, it is supported
by the Tenant Farmers' Association, the National

413.88.text:
Gamekeepers' Organisation, the Moorland Association,
the CLA and the Countryside Alliance. The

420.74.text:
Thame Country Fair is all set for a great
Easter weekend, with the site build well under

425.59.text:
way, ground conditions are good with no lying
snow.

429.46.text:
With all the recent bad weather around the
country, Thame Showground in Oxfordshire has

433.98.text: not seen a snowflake. Visit LivingHeritageCountryShows.co.uk

438.40.text:
Do you have an iPhone, and Android phone and
pressing need to record where, when and what

447.46.text:
you shoot? The Game For Everything Mapping
Application (G4EMA) is your online gamebook.

452.94.text:
Developed by our own Mark Gilchrist and priced
at just £2.99, the app keeps a record of

457.10.text:
where you have been and what you have shot
(while out hunting), caught (while out fishing)

461.96.text:
or even seen (while out birdwatching). When
you have finished, simply press sync data,

466.51.text: go to the G4EMA website and view.

470.12.text:
Fancy some free kit well Schools Challenge
is running a free competition to win £350-worth

475.71.text:
of shooting goodies. Click on the link on
the screen to see details

481.06.text: Animal rights groups are becoming more violent.

484.22.text:
In the week the Surrey Union saw one of its
sabs fined for his offensive behaviour, a

488.82.text:
hunt master in Herefordshire found his pet
dog killed, mutilated and dumped on his driveway.

494.54.text:
Lee Peters of the Ross Harriers says his dog
was battered to death and an Animal Liberation

499.47.text:
Front slogan scratched into his car parked
nearby. Meanwhile, hunting activist Nick Maffia

504.76.text:
from Surrey was fined £150 with £350 court
costs after pleading guilty to the charge

510.95.text:
of using ‘threatening, abusive or insulting
words or behaviour to cause harassment, alarm

516.45.text:
or distress', this took place at the hunt
kennels in Ockley, Surrey, in 2012.

522.05.text:
And finally - are you struggling to find a
good dentist well we might have the answer

526.68.text:
for you. Here's Rodney the pet tawny owl and
a younger brother with a wobbly tooth - the

531.82.text:
boys clearly want to make a quick buck out
of the tooth fairy and Rodney is obviously

535.48.text:
in for a cut of the action. It's a job well
done.

539.93.text:
You are now up to date with Fieldsports Britain
News. Stalking the stories. Fishing for facts.

552.41.text:
Thank you David - now, it's your turn. Please
show us the wonderful places around the world

557.82.text:
where you hunt, shoot and fish. We want to
see what you are up to. We've created a special

562.87.text:
part of the programme called Hallo Charlie.
Using your mobile phone and no more than one

569.00.text:
sentence tell us what you are doing and how
you are doing it. Then share it with us using

573.99.text:
any of the internet' big, free services: Facebook,
Youtube, Twitter, or email charlie@fieldsportschannel.tv

580.20.text:
using Facebook, YouSendIt, you name it we
will do the rest. Just make sure it is one

595.04.text:
Gooday Charlie and crew at Fieldsports Britain,
Pete Kennedy from the New England area of

599.34.text:
northern New South Wales in Australia. At
the moment this is my back yard in the northern

604.03.text:
table lands area. In the last couple of days
the fallow stags have started to rut. There

607.90.text:
is one croaking over to my right as I talk
and I am just out doing what I love to do

617.09.text:
Thank you Pete. Back in England Roy's hanging
out with the chicks - the dead chicks.

621.79.text:
Hello Charlie, Roy here and we are currently
preparing food ready for the birds. It is

627.82.text:
breeding season again and I am just about
to go into hibernation.

631.72.text:
Now, one of the most straightforward, unsarcastic
people you will ever meet.

636.31.text:
Hi Charlie, David here in rural Kent just
mentally preparing for News Stump. Just wanted

641.97.text: to tell you that you ... me.

645.98.text:
Next up, it's Sporting Shooter editor Dom
Holtam, leading the tough life that shooting

653.51.text:
Hi Charlie hope everything is ok with you.
I am not going to lie to you. I have had a

654.46.text:
terrible week this week. The weather has been
awful, I haven't got the content covered ... at

672.95.text:
once. Worst of all I have been stuck doing
boring four wheel drive tests. Dirty job,

676.32.text:
Of course Dom it helps to hold the camera
this way up and not this way up. We want you

682.56.text:
to be as creative as possible send us a five-second
establishing shot showing where you are if

692.57.text:
The most important thing is that you start
it Hallo Charlie.

696.45.text:
Now to the greatest outdoor event in Europe
in 2013 it is the CLA Game Fair. Let's get

706.39.text:
You would hope that a company like Fur Feather
& Fin would live in some quaint rural hamlet

711.43.text:
surrounded by rolling countryside ... and
it doesn't disappoint - the company, which

717.11.text:
started in a stable, has grown-up and into
an ancient barn and courtyard in West Sussex.

722.88.text:
We love being here and also we are opposite
a great pub. The Fox goes Free which is a

728.90.text:
brilliant pub and everybody loves going there
so it is great coming to work every morning.

733.74.text: It even hosts the gathering of the local hunt.

737.41.text:
From here the mail order catalogue company
sends those cups, dog leads, books, games,

741.71.text:
clothes, cushions, socks that make that birthday,
Father's Day, wedding and Christmas Day all

746.65.text:
the more special. It was all started by Angie
Simmonds and her husband.

752.37.text:
You can add a quirkiness to a product. We
have developed cartridge lighters. We have

757.67.text:
developed all sorts of things, glassware with
all sorts of designs on. Labradors are a great

764.55.text:
favourite so anything with a Labrador ... we
go all over the world looking for ideas. We

772.48.text:
might not find a product, but we might get
ideas and then come back and develop it.

778.47.text:
Although people can come along to try stuff
on, it's not a shop. The face to face interfacing

784.10.text:
tends to happen at fairs and shows and in
particular the CLA Game Fair.

788.82.text:
We have lost a lot of our agricultural country
shows and the Game Fair really brings everybody

794.10.text:
back together in one big show and I think
that is clear from the number of people who

798.19.text:
turn up and from the quality of products on
sale really and then it is the perfect opportunity

803.61.text:
for us to meet our customers. You don't get
that on mail order you only hear them or talk

807.55.text:
to them over the phones and the beauty of
doing it at a game fair is that you actually

811.37.text:
get to see them, talk to them, find out feedback
directly from the customers and that is priceless.

817.03.text:
For exhibitors and punters, the cancellation
of the Belvoir Castle game fair last year

821.32.text:
was a huge disappointment. But the conditions
were extraordinary - we went to see for ourselves.

827.90.text:
It was so bad that it was clear the only option
was to cash in the chips and start looking

836.86.text:
And here we are, on a site visit with the
guys who are going to make it happen, come

840.84.text: hell or high water - isn't that right Nick?

845.10.text:
Obviously sadly we didn't manage to stop it
last year. We are not like Kinkton and Newton

849.40.text:
trying to stop the waves coming up the beach.
We put a huge amount of contingency plans

854.66.text:
in, things like trackway, things like bark
chip, monitoring the traffic flows, monitoring

860.03.text:
the lorry flows and that is all you can do.
You just have to hope you are going to get

866.49.text:
Also on site today is Ed de la Rue. if Nick's
job is to make sure you glide in and out of

872.20.text:
the site with minimum fuss, it's Ed's job
to make sure you dance round the game fair.

877.38.text:
The site is wonderful. Unlike a lot of our
other sites which are very flat, here you

880.97.text:
can walk around the showground and see the
furthest bit of the show ground. You can stand

884.38.text:
on the top of a hill and see Bond street going
all the way down. I think that gives a different

888.60.text:
element to what we have always put on as a
show and for me it is definitely one of my

890.51.text:
To be honest we must be mad to even consider
an event of this kind in the UK, where three

898.04.text:
major weather fronts merge, but we do ... and
whether we are into gundogs, apiary, tractors

904.71.text:
or wind turbines it usually works. It's the
outdoor experience that matters.

910.41.text:
The CLA really is certainly of its size and
nature the last remaining nomadic outdoor

918.10.text:
country event and it just gives you that uniqueness
and there is something special about walking

923.91.text:
amongst the great exhibitors that we have.
The whole shopping experience with green under

929.60.text: your feet and blue above your head.

931.88.text:
Back in West Sussex, Rob is dealing with yet
more orders. It's steady this morning, but

937.30.text:
it's not flat-out by any means. The crazy
times are Christmas and of course the CLA

943.38.text:
Game Fair. There needs to be plenty of stock
- packed and ready to go.

948.54.text:
Complete chaos. We have new staff at that
point ready for the start of the shooting

954.19.text:
season and ready for Christmas and a list
will come in from the office saying Rob this

963.09.text:
is what we are taking. There are other staff
here that help out. But I basically just do

970.54.text:
the game cover on my own so that I know what
they have ordered and what they have got is

973.64.text:
One thing Fur Feather & Fin does well is tweed
- and just as well considering the plans afoot

979.13.text: for the CLA this year - let's talk fashion.

982.64.text:
We are looking to develop a fashion village.
Tweed currently seems to be dirigir on my

989.37.text:
way in and out of London every day there are
more and more people wearing tweed and I don't

994.21.text:
think they have seen the countryside. So there
is an appetite for it. We are looking to help

1000.59.text:
that because obviously it is actually our
exhibitors who are selling to those people.

1005.34.text:
The CLA game fair means different things to
different people: it's a party, a shop window,

1010.10.text:
a meeting of minds, a family holiday, a shopping
spree, and it's now a catwalk. What ever you

1015.72.text:
want from it there's a very good chance you'll
find it.

1018.96.text:
The CLA Game Fair 2013 is on 19th - 21st July
at Ragley Hall, Warwickshire. Whether you

1025.79.text:
are a standholder or a visitor, go to www.gamefair.co.uk
and see what it can do for you.

1033.72.text:
Now from a great country show to great country
companions it is the latest in our series

1039.79.text: of expert tips on gun dogs from Skinners Petfoods.

1054.64.text:
Steadiness is like obedience, but much, much
more. Here's how top gundog trainer Ricky

1059.88.text:
Moloney keeps his gundogs steady on a shoot
day.

1064.30.text:
For steadiness we are going back to what we
have been doing really from eight to ten months

1069.42.text:
of age. So I have laid my foundations. Coming
out into the shooting field now I am expecting

1075.63.text:
such likes as Den, Cuba to actually at this
stage know the job. Den did run in today,

1084.69.text:
he did actually go. I have been sending him
quickly for wounded birds, as a side effect

1092.68.text:
he decided that he was going to go before
the command was issued. Not a problem with

1097.92.text:
that. As soon as I growled he knew he had
done wrong, he stopped and he looked at me.

1103.05.text:
That is my side effects, I have created that,
I will overcome that. I want him to be sharp

1108.57.text:
on marked game. The quicker I have the dog
off on a bird especially when it is running,

1114.21.text:
the quicker I am going to put it into the
bag. The longer you delay the more chance

1120.42.text: So you let Gemma pick that bird.

1122.32.text:
The dead bird on the side of the wall wasn't
going anywhere. I said to Gemma is it dead.

1128.12.text:
It was so really it was an opportunity for
me to show my dogs they can hang on and wait

1133.86.text:
because there is another dog. Not every retrieve
is going to be theirs.

1138.43.text:
Ricky Moloney runs Ribblesdale Labradors.
This series on gundog training tips is brought

1142.79.text:
to you by Skinners Petfoods, maker of the
Field & Trial range of gundog feeds. Visit

1152.95.text:
Thank you Skinners. Let's go to the wider
world of hunting, shooting and fishing on

1163.73.text:
This is Hunting YouTube, which aims to show
the best hunting, shooting and fishing videos

1168.45.text:
Now this should have gone into last week's
IWA Special Hunting YouTube. It shows what

1172.17.text:
happens if you make the lads from Jack Pyke
come in too early to stand on their stand

1176.36.text:
at Europe's biggest gun trade show. The Devil
makes work for idle hands and, before long,

1182.01.text:
they are doing the Harlem Shake. Of course,
being dressed in Jack Pyke, they are completely

1186.81.text:
invisible to the naked eye, so you will have
to take my word for it.

1190.54.text:
Now let's get out into the field. Have you
ever dreamed of shooting over a field trial

1194.78.text:
champion spaniel ? Well during this film you
will get a first person point of view as we

1199.48.text:
join Andrew Robinson of Whaupley Gundogs high
up on the North Yorkshire Dales in the UK

1204.92.text:
putting Meadowsedge Shooting Star or "Dizzy",
as she is called, through her paces on rabbits

1210.64.text:
With the roebuck season opening in the UK
on 1st April, now's a good time to watch Deer

1214.82.text:
Stalking - An Introduction from BASCFilms.
It's got hows and whys and wherefores as BASC

1220.45.text:
deer officer Lewis Thornley shows that woodland
stalking is a vital method of managing the

1225.14.text:
UK's expanding deer population as well as
providing excellent venison.

1229.69.text:
Moving to fishing and, by rights, Ali Mufti
should not be able to use YouTube because

1234.75.text:
he lives in Pakistan, where the website is
banned on religious grounds. Ali is a fisherman

1239.66.text:
- indeed he is a leading light in the Pakistan
Game Fish Association - and he has found ways

1244.65.text:
of smuggling his fishing films out of the
country, including this one, called Vertical

1250.51.text:
On to carp fishing and there are now so many
carp channels on YouTube, it was only a matter

1255.57.text:
of time before one of them went 3D on us.
You will need red and cyan glasses to watch

1261.04.text:
this in all its glory, and see carp up to
nearly 50lb in eye popping style.

1266.94.text:
Now, widely regarded as the hardest-core hunters
in the world, NZ Pighunting Hard Core Hokianga

1272.44.text:
by kawez17779 does nothing to dispel the myth
that Kiwis are more fearless than a San tribesman

1279.79.text:
after an eland or a Makah spearing a whale.
Pighunting is, as they eruditely put it, 100%

1286.53.text:
Now for something infinitely more boring yet
still compelling. Roger Jackaman uploads this

1291.45.text:
film about Agron Mala, who is one of the top
airgunners in Kosovo. It is a character piece

1297.36.text:
and it is part of a short series of films
profiling Kosovo and its people.

1301.72.text:
Finally, we're back in the UK where a dreamy,
Ry Cooder-style soundtrack by Flook is the

1307.10.text:
tune that carries you through this charming
film called Boxing Day Shoot 2012.

1312.02.text:
You can click on any of these films to watch
them. If you have a YouTube film you would

1315.23.text:
like us to pop in to the weekly top eight,
send it in via YouTube, or email me the link

1322.92.text:
Another good film for you to watch is the
latest from Schools Challenge TV. It's the

1327.15.text:
event we've been waiting for. The first Schools
Challenge clay competition of 2013 takes place

1332.44.text:
at the Oxford Gun Company. Kids from schools
all over England are here to take part in

1337.67.text:
a festival of clay-smashing designed partly
to find out who's best and mainly to have

1342.10.text:
a fun day they will remember. Click the link
on the screen to watch it.

1347.90.text:
Well we are of course back next week. If you
are watching this on Youtube then don't hesitate

1351.35.text:
to hit the subscribe button which is somewhere
on the outside of the screen there or go to

1354.61.text:
our website www.fieldsportschannel.tv where
you can click to like us on Facebook, or follow

1358.74.text:
us on Twitter or best of all scroll down to
the bottom and pop your email address into

1362.63.text:
the constant contact form there and we will
constantly contact you about our programme

1366.26.text:
which is out 7pm every Wednesday UK time.
This has been Fieldsports Britain.
